com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring.distance

Class DefaultDistanceCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring.distance.DefaultDistanceCalculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DistanceCalculator

    public class DefaultDistanceCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
implements DistanceCalculator
    Calculate the distance between the Android device and PowerMote based on the measured RSSI value and a TX power calibration value at 1 meter.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    See Also:
    DistanceCalculator

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback
      CalibrationCallback provides callbacks indicating whether calibration has been finished successfully or failed.

      • startTxPowerCalibration

        public boolean startTxPowerCalibration(BaseFrame baseFrame,
                              DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback callback)
        Starts TX power calibration at 1 meter for current Android device. Device must be static at the distance of 1 meter from selected PowerMote. You can keep device in hand and stand at the distance of 1 meter.

        The calibration takes less than seconds. If calibration has been finished successfully, the DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback.calibrationSuccessful() callback is triggered, otherwise DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback.calibrationFail() callback is triggered.

        Note: You must manually start scan using the startScan method. Also calibration changes scan settings and you must configure the scan after calibration.

        Parameters:
        baseFrame - The advertising frame instance of selected PowerMote
        callback - Calibration callback
        Returns:
        true if calibrations starts successfully, otherwise false if any calibration has been started already.

      • startTxPowerCalibration

        public boolean startTxPowerCalibration(java.lang.String macAddress,
                              DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback callback)
        Starts TX power calibration at 1 meter for current Android device. Device must be static at the distance of 1 meter from selected PowerMote. You can keep device in hand and stand at the distance of 1 meter.

        The calibration takes less than seconds. If calibration has been finished successfully, the DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback.calibrationSuccessful() callback is triggered, otherwise DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback.calibrationFail() callback is triggered.

        Note: You must manually start scan using the startScan method. Also calibration changes scan settings and you must configure the scan after calibration.

        Parameters:
        macAddress - The MAC address of selected PowerMote
        callback - Calibration callback
        Returns:
        true if calibrations starts successfully, otherwise false if any calibration has been started already.

      • startAttenuationCoefficientCalibration

        public boolean startAttenuationCoefficientCalibration(BaseFrame baseFrame,
                                             DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback callback)
        Starts attenuation coefficient calibration for current Android device. Device must be static at a distance of 5 meter from selected PowerMote. You can keep device in hand and stand at a distance of 5 meter.

        The calibration takes less than seconds. If calibration has been finished successfully, the DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback.calibrationSuccessful() callback is triggered, otherwise DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback.calibrationFail() callback is triggered.

        Note: You must manually start scan using the startScan method. Also calibration changes scan settings and you must configure the scan after calibration.

        Parameters:
        baseFrame - The advertising frame instance of selected PowerMote
        callback - Calibration callback
        Returns:
        true if calibrations starts successfully, otherwise false if any calibration has been started already.

      • startAttenuationCoefficientCalibration

        public boolean startAttenuationCoefficientCalibration(java.lang.String macAddress,
                                             DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback callback)
        Starts attenuation coefficient calibration for current Android device. Device must be static at a distance of 5 meter from selected PowerMote. You can keep device in hand and stand at a distance of 5 meter.

        The calibration takes less than seconds. If calibration has been finished successfully, the DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback.calibrationSuccessful() callback is triggered, otherwise DefaultDistanceCalculator.CalibrationCallback.calibrationFail() callback is triggered.

        Note: You must manually start scan using the startScan method. Also calibration changes scan settings and you must configure the scan after calibration.

        Parameters:
        macAddress - The MAC address of selected PowerMote
        callback - Calibration callback
        Returns:
        true if calibrations starts successfully, otherwise false if any calibration has been started already.
